text: Scirpophaga khasis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Angoon Lewvanich in 1981. It is found in Yunnan in China and in India. The wingspan is 26–33 mm. The forewings are shining pale ochreous white with a dark fuscous spot at the lower angle of the cell. The hindwings are pale ochreous white. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1981 Category:Schoenobiinae Category:Moths of China Category:Moths of India
title: Scirpophaga khasis
